Tree | blank1_info_sec1 = Cryptomeria | blank2_name_sec1 = - Flower | blank2_info_sec1 = Japanese iris | blank3_name_sec1 = | blank3_info_sec1 = | blank4_name_sec1 = | blank4_info_sec1 = | blank5_name_sec1 = | blank5_info_sec1 = | blank6_name_sec1 = | blank6_info_sec1 = | blank7_name_sec1 = | blank7_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = Phone number | blank_info_sec2 = 0595-82-1111 | blank1_name_sec2 = Address | blank1_info_sec2 = 577 Honmaru-cho, Kameyama-shi, Mie-ken 519-0195 | website = | footnotes = }} is a Japanese city in Mie Prefecture on the island of Honshū. ==History== In the Edo period, Kameyama-juku, Seki-juku and Sakanoshita-juku were the 46th, 47th, and 48th of the 53 shogunate-maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, "Tōkaidō" at p. 973. All three Tōkaidō rest stops are within the boundaries of modern Numazu. ==Gallery== File:Hiroshige47 kameyama.jpg|Kameyama rest stop by Hiroshige, ukiyo-e woodblock print c. 1830s File:Hiroshige48 seki.jpg|Seki rest stop by Hiroshige, c. 1830s File:Hiroshige49 sakanoshita.jpg|Sakanoshita rest stop by Hiroshige, c. 1830s File:亀山城多聞櫓.JPG|Stone wall at former Kameyama Castle File:Kameyama Station old.jpg|Kameyama railway station, early Taishō period (1912–1926) ==Related pages== * The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== ==Other websites== * Kameyama City website * Hiroshige prints, Kameyama , Seki , Sakanoshita Category:Cities in Mie Prefecture
title: Kameyama, Mie
